   449â†’    async def process_high_impact_event(self, event: LearningEvent):
   450â†’        """Process high-impact learning event immediately"""
   451â†’        self.logger.info(f"âš¡ Processing high-impact event: {event.event_id}")
   452â†’        
   453â†’        # Create knowledge nodes from insights
   454â†’        for insight in event.learning_insights:
   455â†’            await self.create_knowledge_node(insight, event)
   456â†’        
   457â†’        # Generate compound effect
   458â†’        compound_effect = CompoundEffect(
   459â†’            effect_id=self.generate_effect_id(),
   460â†’            primary_component=event.source_component,
   461â†’            affected_components=event.propagation_targets,
   462â†’            effect_type="high_impact_learning",
   463â†’            magnitude=event.compound_potential,
   464â†’            propagation_path=[event.source_component] + event.propagation_targets,
   465â†’            amplification_factor=1.0 + event.compound_potential,
   466â†’            duration=None,
   467â†’            measurable_outcomes=[]
   468â†’        )
   469â†’        
   470â†’        # Add to active effects
   471â†’        self.active_compound_effects[compound_effect.effect_id] = compound_effect
   472â†’        
   473â†’        # Queue for propagation
   474â†’        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(compound_effect)
   475â†’
   476â†’    def generate_effect_id(self) -> str:
   477â†’        """Generate unique compound effect ID"""
   478â†’        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%f")
   479â†’        return f"effect_{timestamp}"
   480â†’
   481â†’    async def create_knowledge_node(self, insight: str, source_event: LearningEvent):
   482â†’        """Create knowledge node from learning insight"""
   483â†’        
   484â†’        node_id = hashlib.md5(insight.encode()).hexdigest()[:12]
   485â†’        
   486â†’        # Check if node already exists
   487â†’        if node_id in self.knowledge_nodes:
   488â†’            # Update existing node
   489â†’            existing_node = self.knowledge_nodes[node_id]
   490â†’            existing_node.usage_frequency += 1
   491â†’            existing_node.last_updated = datetime.now().isoformat()
   492â†’            existing_node.velocity_contribution += source_event.velocity_impact
   493â†’        else:
   494â†’            # Create new node
   495â†’            node = KnowledgeNode(
   496â†’                node_id=node_id,
   497â†’                knowledge_type=source_event.interaction_type,
   498â†’                content={
   499â†’                    "insight": insight,
   500â†’                    "source_component": source_event.source_component,
   501â†’                    "context": source_event.context_data
   502â†’                },
   503â†’                confidence_level=source_event.confidence_score,
   504â†’                creation_timestamp=datetime.now().isoformat(),
   505â†’                last_updated=datetime.now().isoformat(),
   506â†’                usage_frequency=1,
   507â†’                velocity_contribution=source_event.velocity_impact,
   508â†’                connections=[],
   509â†’                evolution_history=[]
   510â†’            )
   511â†’            
   512â†’            self.knowledge_nodes[node_id] = node
   513â†’            self.knowledge_network.add_node(node_id, **asdict(node))
   514â†’        
   515â†’        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ’¡ Knowledge node created/updated: {node_id}")
   516â†’
   517â†’    async def process_learning_events(self, events: List[LearningEvent]):
   518â†’        """Process batch of learning events for compound effects"""
   519â†’        
   520â†’        if not events:
   521â†’            return
   522â†’        
   523â†’        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ”„ Processing {len(events)} learning events for compound effects...")
   524â†’        
   525â†’        # Group events by component
   526â†’        events_by_component = defaultdict(list)
   527â†’        for event in events:
   528â†’            events_by_component[event.source_component].append(event)
   529â†’        
   530â†’        # Calculate cross-component compound effects
   531â†’        for component, component_events in events_by_component.items():
   532â†’            if len(component_events) > 1:
   533â†’                # Multiple events from same component - compound effect opportunity
   534â†’                await self.create_component_compound_effect(component, component_events)
   535â†’        
   536â†’        # Identify cross-component learning patterns
   537â†’        if len(events_by_component) > 1:
   538â†’            await self.identify_cross_component_patterns(events_by_component)
   539â†’
   540â†’    async def create_component_compound_effect(self, component: str, events: List[LearningEvent]):
   541â†’        """Create compound effect from multiple events in same component"""
   542â†’        
   543â†’        total_velocity_impact = sum(e.velocity_impact for e in events)
   544â†’        avg_confidence = sum(e.confidence_score for e in events) / len(events)
   545â†’        
   546â†’        # Calculate amplification from multiple events
   547â†’        amplification_factor = 1.0 + (len(events) - 1) * 0.2  # 20% bonus per additional event
   548â†’        
   549â†’        compound_effect = CompoundEffect(
   550â†’            effect_id=self.generate_effect_id(),
   551â†’            primary_component=component,
   552â†’            affected_components=list(set(target for e in events for target in e.propagation_targets)),
   553â†’            effect_type="component_compound",
   554â†’            magnitude=total_velocity_impact * amplification_factor,
   555â†’            propagation_path=[component],
   556â†’            amplification_factor=amplification_factor,
   557â†’            duration="persistent",
   558â†’            measurable_outcomes=[
   559â†’                {"metric": "velocity_impact", "value": total_velocity_impact * amplification_factor},
   560â†’                {"metric": "event_count", "value": len(events)},
   561â†’                {"metric": "confidence", "value": avg_confidence}
   562â†’            ]
   563â†’        )
   564â†’        
   565â†’        self.active_compound_effects[compound_effect.effect_id] = compound_effect
   566â†’        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(compound_effect)
   567â†’        
   568â†’        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ”„ Component compound effect created: {component} (amplification: {amplification_factor:.2f})")
   569â†’
   570â†’    async def identify_cross_component_patterns(self, events_by_component: Dict[str, List[LearningEvent]]):
   571â†’        """Identify patterns across multiple components"""
   572â†’        
   573â†’        # Look for synchronous learning across components
   574â†’        time_windows = defaultdict(list)
   575â†’        
   576â†’        for component, events in events_by_component.items():
   577â†’            for event in events:
   578â†’                timestamp = datetime.fromisoformat(event.timestamp)
   579â†’                time_window = timestamp.replace(second=0, microsecond=0)  # Group by minute
   580â†’                time_windows[time_window].append((component, event))
   581â†’        
   582â†’        # Find time windows with multiple components
   583â†’        for time_window, component_events in time_windows.items():
   584â†’            if len(set(ce[0] for ce in component_events)) > 1:  # Multiple components
   585â†’                await self.create_cross_component_effect(time_window, component_events)
   586â†’
   587â†’    async def create_cross_component_effect(self, time_window: datetime, component_events: List[Tuple[str, LearningEvent]]):
   588â†’        """Create compound effect from cross-component learning"""
   589â†’        
   590â†’        components = list(set(ce[0] for ce in component_events))
   591â†’        events = [ce[1] for ce in component_events]
   592â†’        
   593â†’        # Calculate cross-component synergy
   594â†’        total_impact = sum(e.velocity_impact for e in events)
   595â†’        synergy_bonus = len(components) * 0.15  # 15% bonus per component
   596â†’        
   597â†’        compound_effect = CompoundEffect(
   598â†’            effect_id=self.generate_effect_id(),
   599â†’            primary_component="system_wide",
   600â†’            affected_components=components,
   601â†’            effect_type="cross_component_synergy",
   602â†’            magnitude=total_impact * (1.0 + synergy_bonus),
   603â†’            propagation_path=components,
   604â†’            amplification_factor=1.0 + synergy_bonus,
   605â†’            duration="extended",
   606â†’            measurable_outcomes=[
   607â†’                {"metric": "synergy_impact", "value": total_impact * (1.0 + synergy_bonus)},
   608â†’                {"metric": "components_involved", "value": len(components)},
   609â†’                {"metric": "time_window", "value": time_window.isoformat()}
   610â†’            ]
   611â†’        )
   612â†’        
   613â†’        self.active_compound_effects[compound_effect.effect_id] = compound_effect
   614â†’        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(compound_effect)
   615â†’        
   616â†’        self.logger.info(f"ðŸŒ Cross-component effect created: {len(components)} components (synergy: {synergy_bonus:.1%})")
   617â†’
   618â†’    async def propagate_compound_effect(self, effect: CompoundEffect):
   619â†’        """Propagate compound effect to target components"""
   620â†’        
   621â†’        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“¡ Propagating compound effect: {effect.effect_id}")
   622â†’        
   623â†’        # Propagate to each affected component
   624â†’        for component in effect.affected_components:
   625â†’            await self.propagate_to_component(component, effect)
   626â†’        
   627â†’        # Update system velocity based on effect
   628â†’        velocity_increase = effect.magnitude * 0.1  # 10% of magnitude becomes velocity
   629â†’        self.current_velocity = min(self.current_velocity + velocity_increase, 5.0)  # Cap at 5x
   630â†’
   631â†’    async def propagate_to_component(self, component: str, effect: CompoundEffect):
   632â†’        """Propagate effect to specific component"""
   633â†’        
   634â†’        # Component-specific propagation logic
   635â†’        if component in self.component_coordinators:
   636â†’            coordinator = self.component_coordinators[component]
   637â†’            try:
   638â†’                await coordinator(effect)
   639â†’                self.logger.info(f"âœ… Effect propagated to {component}")
   640â†’            except Exception as e:
   641â†’                self.logger.error(f"Effect propagation failed for {component}: {e}")
   642â†’
   643â†’    async def measure_compound_velocity(self) -> VelocityMeasurement:
   644â†’        """Measure current compound velocity"""
   645â†’        
   646â†’        # Count learning events in measurement window
   647â†’        current_time = datetime.now()
   648â†’        window_start = current_time - timedelta(seconds=self.measurement_frequency)
   649â†’        
   650â†’        # Count events in current window
   651â†’        events_count = 0
   652â†’        total_impact = 0.0
   653â†’        contributing_components = set()
   654â†’        
   655â†’        # Read recent events
   656â†’        if self.learning_events.exists():
   657â†’            with open(self.learning_events, 'r') as f:
   658â†’                for line in f:
   659â†’                    try:
   660â†’                        event_data = json.loads(line.strip())
   661â†’                        event_time = datetime.fromisoformat(event_data["timestamp"])
   662â†’                        
   663â†’                        if event_time >= window_start:
   664â†’                            events_count += 1
   665â†’                            total_impact += event_data.get("velocity_impact", 0.0)
   666â†’                            contributing_components.add(event_data["source_component"])
   667â†’                    except (json.JSONDecodeError, KeyError, ValueError):
   668â†’                        continue
   669â†’        
   670â†’        # Calculate compound effects
   671â†’        compound_effects_data = []
   672â†’        total_amplification = 1.0
   673â†’        
   674â†’        for effect in self.active_compound_effects.values():
   675â†’            effect_data = {
   676â†’                "effect_id": effect.effect_id,
   677â†’                "magnitude": effect.magnitude,
   678â†’                "amplification": effect.amplification_factor
   679â†’            }
   680â†’            compound_effects_data.append(effect_data)
   681â†’            total_amplification *= effect.amplification_factor
   682â†’        
   683â†’        # Calculate current velocity with compound effects
   684â†’        velocity_from_events = 1.0 + total_impact
   685â†’        current_velocity = velocity_from_events * min(total_amplification, 3.0)  # Cap amplification at 3x
   686â†’        
   687â†’        # Calculate improvement factor
   688â†’        improvement_factor = current_velocity / self.velocity_baseline
   689â†’        
   690â†’        # Calculate acceleration rate (change in improvement over time)
   691â†’        acceleration_rate = 0.0
   692â†’        if hasattr(self, 'previous_improvement'):
   693â†’            time_delta = self.measurement_frequency / 3600.0  # Convert to hours
   694â†’            acceleration_rate = (improvement_factor - self.previous_improvement) / time_delta
   695â†’        
   696â†’        self.previous_improvement = improvement_factor
   697â†’        
   698â†’        measurement = VelocityMeasurement(
   699â†’            measurement_id=self.generate_measurement_id(),
   700â†’            timestamp=current_time.isoformat(),
   701â†’            baseline_velocity=self.velocity_baseline,
   702â†’            current_velocity=current_velocity,
   703â†’            improvement_factor=improvement_factor,
   704â†’            contributing_components=list(contributing_components),
   705â†’            learning_events_count=events_count,
   706â†’            compound_effects=compound_effects_data,
   707â†’            acceleration_rate=acceleration_rate,
   708â†’            sustainability_score=self.calculate_sustainability_score(improvement_factor, acceleration_rate)
   709â†’        )
   710â†’        
   711â†’        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“ˆ Velocity measured: {current_velocity:.2f} (factor: {improvement_factor:.2f})")
   712â†’        return measurement
   713â†’
   714â†’    def generate_measurement_id(self) -> str:

   716â†’        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
   717â†’        return f"velocity_{timestamp}"
   718â†’
   719â†’    def calculate_sustainability_score(self, improvement_factor: float, acceleration_rate: float) -> float:
   720â†’        """Calculate sustainability score for velocity improvements"""
   721â†’        
   722â†’        # Sustainability decreases with extreme improvements (unsustainable)
   723â†’        improvement_sustainability = 1.0 - max(0, (improvement_factor - 2.0) / 3.0)
   724â†’        
   725â†’        # Positive acceleration is good, but extreme acceleration is unsustainable
   726â†’        acceleration_sustainability = 1.0 - abs(acceleration_rate) / 10.0
   727â†’        acceleration_sustainability = max(0.0, acceleration_sustainability)
   728â†’        
   729â†’        # Combine factors
   730â†’        sustainability = (improvement_sustainability + acceleration_sustainability) / 2.0
   731â†’        
   732â†’        return max(0.0, min(1.0, sustainability))
   733â†’
   734â†’    async def store_velocity_measurement(self, measurement: VelocityMeasurement):

   774â†’            duration="temporary",

   777â†’            ]
   778â†’        )
   779â†’        
   780â†’        self.active_compound_effects[amplification_effect.effect_id] = amplification_effect
   781â†’        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(amplification_effect)
   782â†’

   840â†’    def calculate_node_similarity(self, node_a: KnowledgeNode, node_b: KnowledgeNode) -> float:

   842â†’

   844â†’        type_similarity = 1.0 if node_a.knowledge_type == node_b.knowledge_type else 0.3
   845â†’

   847â†’        source_b = node_b.content.get("source_component", "")
   848â†’        source_similarity = 0.8 if source_a == source_b else 0.2
   849â†’        
   850â†’        # Content similarity (simplified)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
COMPOUND LEARNING INFRASTRUCTURE v1.0
Renaissance AI-Agentic System - Velocity Compounding Engine

Purpose: Central coordination system ensuring every interaction compounds future velocity through systematic learning
Authority: Master learning orchestrator integrating all optimization components for continuous system evolution
Created: 2025-08-10

Key Capabilities:
- Every-interaction learning loop coordination
- Cross-component knowledge synthesis and propagation
- Compound velocity measurement and amplification
- System-wide learning pattern recognition and optimization
- Autonomous knowledge graph evolution and refinement
- Meta-learning for continuous system architecture improvement
"""

import os
import sys
import json
import asyncio
import logging
import hashlib
import networkx as nx
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional, Tuple, Set
from dataclasses import dataclass, asdict
from collections import defaultdict, deque
import numpy as np

# Add project root to path
PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent
sys.path.append(str(PROJECT_ROOT))

@dataclass
class LearningEvent:
    """Represents a single learning event from system interaction"""
    event_id: str
    timestamp: str
    source_component: str
    interaction_type: str
    context_data: Dict[str, Any]
    learning_insights: List[str]
    velocity_impact: float
    confidence_score: float
    propagation_targets: List[str]
    compound_potential: float

@dataclass
class VelocityMeasurement:
    """Represents a compound velocity measurement"""
    measurement_id: str
    timestamp: str
    baseline_velocity: float
    current_velocity: float
    improvement_factor: float
    contributing_components: List[str]
    learning_events_count: int
    compound_effects: List[Dict[str, Any]]
    acceleration_rate: float
    sustainability_score: float

@dataclass
class KnowledgeNode:
    """Represents a node in the compound learning knowledge graph"""
    node_id: str
    knowledge_type: str
    content: Dict[str, Any]
    confidence_level: float
    creation_timestamp: str
    last_updated: str
    usage_frequency: int
    velocity_contribution: float
    connections: List[str]
    evolution_history: List[Dict[str, Any]]

@dataclass
class CompoundEffect:
    """Represents a compound learning effect across system components"""
    effect_id: str
    primary_component: str
    affected_components: List[str]
    effect_type: str
    magnitude: float
    propagation_path: List[str]
    amplification_factor: float
    duration: Optional[str]
    measurable_outcomes: List[Dict[str, Any]]

class CompoundLearningInfrastructure:
    """
    Master learning orchestrator ensuring every interaction compounds future velocity
    
    This infrastructure:
    1. Coordinates learning across all system components
    2. Measures and amplifies compound velocity effects
    3. Synthesizes knowledge from diverse interaction patterns
    4. Evolves system architecture through meta-learning
    5. Propagates insights for maximum compound benefit
    6. Ensures sustainable velocity improvement over time
    """
    
    def __init__(self, workspace_root: str = "E:/systems/ai/agentic"):
        self.workspace_root = Path(workspace_root)
        self.learning_data_dir = self.workspace_root / "intelligence/learning"
        
        # Learning infrastructure databases
        self.learning_events = self.learning_data_dir / "learning_events.jsonl"
        self.velocity_measurements = self.learning_data_dir / "velocity_measurements.json"
        self.knowledge_graph = self.learning_data_dir / "knowledge_graph.json"
        self.compound_effects = self.learning_data_dir / "compound_effects.json"
        self.meta_learning = self.learning_data_dir / "meta_learning.json"
        self.system_evolution = self.learning_data_dir / "system_evolution.json"
        
        # Initialize learning infrastructure
        self.setup_learning_infrastructure()
        self.setup_logging()
        
        # Learning coordination
        self.component_coordinators = {
            "self_optimizing_orchestrator": self.coordinate_orchestrator_learning,
            "workspace_analyzer": self.coordinate_analyzer_learning,
            "continuous_optimizer": self.coordinate_optimizer_learning,
            "module_registry": self.coordinate_registry_learning,
            "command_surface_manager": self.coordinate_command_learning,
            "agent_lifecycle_manager": self.coordinate_agent_learning,
            "sequential_thinking": self.coordinate_thinking_learning
        }
        
        # Velocity measurement
        self.velocity_baseline = 1.0
        self.current_velocity = 1.0
        self.measurement_frequency = 300  # 5 minutes
        self.learning_events_buffer = deque(maxlen=1000)
        
        # Knowledge graph
        self.knowledge_network = nx.MultiDiGraph()
        self.knowledge_nodes: Dict[str, KnowledgeNode] = {}
        
        # Compound effect tracking
        self.active_compound_effects: Dict[str, CompoundEffect] = {}
        self.effect_propagation_queue = deque(maxlen=500)
        
        # Meta-learning
        self.architecture_evolution_patterns = defaultdict(list)
        self.learning_effectiveness_metrics = defaultdict(list)
        
        # Background processing
        self.learning_loop_active = False
        self.velocity_monitoring_active = False
        
        self.logger.info("ðŸš€ Compound Learning Infrastructure initialized - Every interaction will compound velocity")

    def setup_learning_infrastructure(self):
        """Setup compound learning infrastructure"""
        directories = [
            self.learning_data_dir,
            self.learning_data_dir / "events",
            self.learning_data_dir / "velocity",
            self.learning_data_dir / "knowledge",
            self.learning_data_dir / "effects",
            self.learning_data_dir / "meta"
        ]
        
        for directory in directories:
            directory.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

    def setup_logging(self):
        """Setup compound learning specific logging"""
        log_dir = self.workspace_root / "logs" / "compound_learning"
        log_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
        logging.basicConfig(
            level=logging.INFO,
            format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
            handlers=[
                logging.FileHandler(log_dir / f"compound_learning_{datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d')}.log"),
                logging.StreamHandler()
            ]
        )
        self.logger = logging.getLogger(self.__class__.__name__)

    async def initialize_compound_learning_system(self):
        """Initialize the complete compound learning system"""
        self.logger.info("ðŸ§  Initializing compound learning system...")
        
        # Load existing knowledge graph
        await self.load_knowledge_graph()
        
        # Load velocity baseline
        await self.load_velocity_baseline()
        
        # Start learning coordination loops
        await self.start_learning_loops()
        
        # Initialize component integrations
        await self.initialize_component_integrations()
        
        self.logger.info("âœ… Compound learning system initialized - Every interaction ready for velocity compounding")

    async def load_knowledge_graph(self):
        """Load existing knowledge graph"""
        if self.knowledge_graph.exists():
            with open(self.knowledge_graph, 'r') as f:
                graph_data = json.load(f)
            
            # Reconstruct knowledge network
            for node_data in graph_data.get("nodes", []):
                node = KnowledgeNode(**node_data)
                self.knowledge_nodes[node.node_id] = node
                self.knowledge_network.add_node(node.node_id, **asdict(node))
            
            # Reconstruct edges
            for edge_data in graph_data.get("edges", []):
                self.knowledge_network.add_edge(
                    edge_data["source"],
                    edge_data["target"],
                    **edge_data.get("attributes", {})
                )
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“š Knowledge graph loaded: {len(self.knowledge_nodes)} nodes")

    async def load_velocity_baseline(self):
        """Load velocity baseline and current measurements"""
        if self.velocity_measurements.exists():
            with open(self.velocity_measurements, 'r') as f:
                measurements = json.load(f)
            
            if measurements:
                latest = measurements[-1]
                self.velocity_baseline = latest.get("baseline_velocity", 1.0)
                self.current_velocity = latest.get("current_velocity", 1.0)
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“ˆ Velocity baseline loaded: {self.velocity_baseline:.2f}, current: {self.current_velocity:.2f}")

    async def start_learning_loops(self):
        """Start continuous learning coordination loops"""
        if not self.learning_loop_active:
            self.learning_loop_active = True
            asyncio.create_task(self.master_learning_loop())
            asyncio.create_task(self.velocity_monitoring_loop())
            asyncio.create_task(self.compound_effect_propagation_loop())
            asyncio.create_task(self.meta_learning_loop())
        
        self.logger.info("ðŸ”„ Learning coordination loops started")

    async def initialize_component_integrations(self):
        """Initialize integrations with all system components"""
        integration_status = {}
        
        for component_name, coordinator in self.component_coordinators.items():
            try:
                await coordinator()
                integration_status[component_name] = "integrated"
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.error(f"Component integration failed for {component_name}: {e}")
                integration_status[component_name] = "failed"
        
        successful_integrations = sum(1 for status in integration_status.values() if status == "integrated")
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ”— Component integrations: {successful_integrations}/{len(self.component_coordinators)} successful")

    async def master_learning_loop(self):
        """Master coordination loop for compound learning"""
        while self.learning_loop_active:
            try:
                await asyncio.sleep(60)  # Run every minute
                
                # Process learning events buffer
                if self.learning_events_buffer:
                    await self.process_learning_events(list(self.learning_events_buffer))
                    self.learning_events_buffer.clear()
                
                # Update knowledge graph
                await self.evolve_knowledge_graph()
                
                # Calculate compound effects
                await self.calculate_compound_effects()
                
                # Trigger system optimizations
                await self.trigger_system_optimizations()
                
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.error(f"Master learning loop error: {e}")
                await asyncio.sleep(60)

    async def velocity_monitoring_loop(self):
        """Continuous velocity monitoring and measurement"""
        while self.velocity_monitoring_active:
            try:
                await asyncio.sleep(self.measurement_frequency)
                
                # Measure current velocity
                measurement = await self.measure_compound_velocity()
                
                # Store measurement
                await self.store_velocity_measurement(measurement)
                
                # Update current velocity
                self.current_velocity = measurement.current_velocity
                
                # Check for velocity acceleration opportunities
                if measurement.improvement_factor > 1.2:  # 20% improvement
                    await self.amplify_velocity_improvements(measurement)
                
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.error(f"Velocity monitoring error: {e}")
                await asyncio.sleep(300)

    async def compound_effect_propagation_loop(self):
        """Propagate compound effects across system components"""
        while self.learning_loop_active:
            try:
                await asyncio.sleep(30)  # Check every 30 seconds
                
                # Process effect propagation queue
                while self.effect_propagation_queue:
                    effect = self.effect_propagation_queue.popleft()
                    await self.propagate_compound_effect(effect)
                
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.error(f"Effect propagation error: {e}")
                await asyncio.sleep(60)

    async def meta_learning_loop(self):
        """Meta-learning loop for system architecture evolution"""
        while self.learning_loop_active:
            try:
                await asyncio.sleep(3600)  # Run every hour
                
                # Analyze learning effectiveness
                effectiveness_analysis = await self.analyze_learning_effectiveness()
                
                # Identify architecture evolution opportunities
                evolution_opportunities = await self.identify_architecture_evolution_opportunities()
                
                # Apply meta-learning insights
                if evolution_opportunities:
                    await self.apply_meta_learning_insights(evolution_opportunities)
                
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.error(f"Meta-learning loop error: {e}")
                await asyncio.sleep(3600)

    async def record_learning_event(
        self, 
        source_component: str, 
        interaction_type: str,
        context_data: Dict[str, Any],
        learning_insights: List[str],
        velocity_impact: float = 0.0,
        confidence_score: float = 0.7
    ) -> str:
        """Record a learning event for compound velocity calculation"""
        
        event = LearningEvent(
            event_id=self.generate_event_id(),
            timestamp=datetime.now().isoformat(),
            source_component=source_component,
            interaction_type=interaction_type,
            context_data=context_data,
            learning_insights=learning_insights,
            velocity_impact=velocity_impact,
            confidence_score=confidence_score,
            propagation_targets=self.determine_propagation_targets(source_component, interaction_type),
            compound_potential=self.calculate_compound_potential(learning_insights, velocity_impact)
        )
        
        # Add to buffer for processing
        self.learning_events_buffer.append(event)
        
        # Store event
        await self.store_learning_event(event)
        
        # Immediate high-impact processing
        if event.compound_potential > 0.7:
            await self.process_high_impact_event(event)
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“ Learning event recorded: {event.source_component} ({event.compound_potential:.2f} potential)")
        return event.event_id

    def generate_event_id(self) -> str:
        """Generate unique event ID"""
        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%f")
        return f"learn_{timestamp}"

    def determine_propagation_targets(self, source_component: str, interaction_type: str) -> List[str]:
        """Determine which components should receive learning propagation"""
        
        # Component interaction map
        propagation_map = {
            "self_optimizing_orchestrator": ["agent_lifecycle_manager", "continuous_optimizer"],
            "workspace_analyzer": ["module_registry", "command_surface_manager"],
            "continuous_optimizer": ["sequential_thinking", "module_registry"],
            "module_registry": ["self_optimizing_orchestrator", "agent_lifecycle_manager"],
            "command_surface_manager": ["workspace_analyzer", "continuous_optimizer"],
            "agent_lifecycle_manager": ["self_optimizing_orchestrator", "sequential_thinking"],
            "sequential_thinking": ["continuous_optimizer", "agent_lifecycle_manager"]
        }
        
        # Base targets from map
        targets = propagation_map.get(source_component, [])
        
        # Add interaction-specific targets
        if interaction_type == "pattern_detection":
            targets.extend(["command_surface_manager", "agent_lifecycle_manager"])
        elif interaction_type == "optimization_applied":
            targets.extend(["module_registry", "sequential_thinking"])
        elif interaction_type == "agent_spawned":
            targets.extend(["self_optimizing_orchestrator", "workspace_analyzer"])
        
        return list(set(targets))

    def calculate_compound_potential(self, insights: List[str], velocity_impact: float) -> float:
        """Calculate compound potential of learning event"""
        
        # Base potential from velocity impact
        base_potential = min(velocity_impact, 1.0)
        
        # Enhancement from insights quality
        insight_quality_indicators = [
            "optimization", "velocity", "compound", "improvement", "efficiency",
            "automation", "pattern", "boundary", "interface"
        ]
        
        insight_quality = 0.0
        for insight in insights:
            quality_score = sum(1 for indicator in insight_quality_indicators 
                              if indicator in insight.lower())
            insight_quality += quality_score / len(insight_quality_indicators)
        
        # Average insight quality
        if insights:
            insight_quality /= len(insights)
        
        # Compound potential calculation
        compound_potential = (base_potential * 0.6 + insight_quality * 0.4)
        
        return min(compound_potential, 1.0)

    async def store_learning_event(self, event: LearningEvent):
        """Store learning event to persistent storage"""
        
        # Append to JSONL file for efficient streaming processing
        with open(self.learning_events, 'a') as f:
            f.write(json.dumps(asdict(event)) + '\n')

    async def process_high_impact_event(self, event: LearningEvent):
        """Process high-impact learning event immediately"""
        self.logger.info(f"âš¡ Processing high-impact event: {event.event_id}")
        
        # Create knowledge nodes from insights
        for insight in event.learning_insights:
            await self.create_knowledge_node(insight, event)
        
        # Generate compound effect
        compound_effect = CompoundEffect(
            effect_id=self.generate_effect_id(),
            primary_component=event.source_component,
            affected_components=event.propagation_targets,
            effect_type="high_impact_learning",
            magnitude=event.compound_potential,
            propagation_path=[event.source_component] + event.propagation_targets,
            amplification_factor=1.0 + event.compound_potential,
            duration=None,
            measurable_outcomes=[]
        )
        
        # Add to active effects
        self.active_compound_effects[compound_effect.effect_id] = compound_effect
        
        # Queue for propagation
        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(compound_effect)

    def generate_effect_id(self) -> str:
        """Generate unique compound effect ID"""
        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%f")
        return f"effect_{timestamp}"

    async def create_knowledge_node(self, insight: str, source_event: LearningEvent):
        """Create knowledge node from learning insight"""
        
        node_id = hashlib.md5(insight.encode()).hexdigest()[:12]
        
        # Check if node already exists
        if node_id in self.knowledge_nodes:
            # Update existing node
            existing_node = self.knowledge_nodes[node_id]
            existing_node.usage_frequency += 1
            existing_node.last_updated = datetime.now().isoformat()
            existing_node.velocity_contribution += source_event.velocity_impact
        else:
            # Create new node
            node = KnowledgeNode(
                node_id=node_id,
                knowledge_type=source_event.interaction_type,
                content={
                    "insight": insight,
                    "source_component": source_event.source_component,
                    "context": source_event.context_data
                },
                confidence_level=source_event.confidence_score,
                creation_timestamp=datetime.now().isoformat(),
                last_updated=datetime.now().isoformat(),
                usage_frequency=1,
                velocity_contribution=source_event.velocity_impact,
                connections=[],
                evolution_history=[]
            )
            
            self.knowledge_nodes[node_id] = node
            self.knowledge_network.add_node(node_id, **asdict(node))
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ’¡ Knowledge node created/updated: {node_id}")

    async def process_learning_events(self, events: List[LearningEvent]):
        """Process batch of learning events for compound effects"""
        
        if not events:
            return
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ”„ Processing {len(events)} learning events for compound effects...")
        
        # Group events by component
        events_by_component = defaultdict(list)
        for event in events:
            events_by_component[event.source_component].append(event)
        
        # Calculate cross-component compound effects
        for component, component_events in events_by_component.items():
            if len(component_events) > 1:
                # Multiple events from same component - compound effect opportunity
                await self.create_component_compound_effect(component, component_events)
        
        # Identify cross-component learning patterns
        if len(events_by_component) > 1:
            await self.identify_cross_component_patterns(events_by_component)

    async def create_component_compound_effect(self, component: str, events: List[LearningEvent]):
        """Create compound effect from multiple events in same component"""
        
        total_velocity_impact = sum(e.velocity_impact for e in events)
        avg_confidence = sum(e.confidence_score for e in events) / len(events)
        
        # Calculate amplification from multiple events
        amplification_factor = 1.0 + (len(events) - 1) * 0.2  # 20% bonus per additional event
        
        compound_effect = CompoundEffect(
            effect_id=self.generate_effect_id(),
            primary_component=component,
            affected_components=list(set(target for e in events for target in e.propagation_targets)),
            effect_type="component_compound",
            magnitude=total_velocity_impact * amplification_factor,
            propagation_path=[component],
            amplification_factor=amplification_factor,
            duration="persistent",
            measurable_outcomes=[
                {"metric": "velocity_impact", "value": total_velocity_impact * amplification_factor},
                {"metric": "event_count", "value": len(events)},
                {"metric": "confidence", "value": avg_confidence}
            ]
        )
        
        self.active_compound_effects[compound_effect.effect_id] = compound_effect
        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(compound_effect)
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ”„ Component compound effect created: {component} (amplification: {amplification_factor:.2f})")

    async def identify_cross_component_patterns(self, events_by_component: Dict[str, List[LearningEvent]]):
        """Identify patterns across multiple components"""
        
        # Look for synchronous learning across components
        time_windows = defaultdict(list)
        
        for component, events in events_by_component.items():
            for event in events:
                timestamp = datetime.fromisoformat(event.timestamp)
                time_window = timestamp.replace(second=0, microsecond=0)  # Group by minute
                time_windows[time_window].append((component, event))
        
        # Find time windows with multiple components
        for time_window, component_events in time_windows.items():
            if len(set(ce[0] for ce in component_events)) > 1:  # Multiple components
                await self.create_cross_component_effect(time_window, component_events)

    async def create_cross_component_effect(self, time_window: datetime, component_events: List[Tuple[str, LearningEvent]]):
        """Create compound effect from cross-component learning"""
        
        components = list(set(ce[0] for ce in component_events))
        events = [ce[1] for ce in component_events]
        
        # Calculate cross-component synergy
        total_impact = sum(e.velocity_impact for e in events)
        synergy_bonus = len(components) * 0.15  # 15% bonus per component
        
        compound_effect = CompoundEffect(
            effect_id=self.generate_effect_id(),
            primary_component="system_wide",
            affected_components=components,
            effect_type="cross_component_synergy",
            magnitude=total_impact * (1.0 + synergy_bonus),
            propagation_path=components,
            amplification_factor=1.0 + synergy_bonus,
            duration="extended",
            measurable_outcomes=[
                {"metric": "synergy_impact", "value": total_impact * (1.0 + synergy_bonus)},
                {"metric": "components_involved", "value": len(components)},
                {"metric": "time_window", "value": time_window.isoformat()}
            ]
        )
        
        self.active_compound_effects[compound_effect.effect_id] = compound_effect
        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(compound_effect)
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸŒ Cross-component effect created: {len(components)} components (synergy: {synergy_bonus:.1%})")

    async def propagate_compound_effect(self, effect: CompoundEffect):
        """Propagate compound effect to target components"""
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“¡ Propagating compound effect: {effect.effect_id}")
        
        # Propagate to each affected component
        for component in effect.affected_components:
            await self.propagate_to_component(component, effect)
        
        # Update system velocity based on effect
        velocity_increase = effect.magnitude * 0.1  # 10% of magnitude becomes velocity
        self.current_velocity = min(self.current_velocity + velocity_increase, 5.0)  # Cap at 5x

    async def propagate_to_component(self, component: str, effect: CompoundEffect):
        """Propagate effect to specific component"""
        
        # Component-specific propagation logic
        if component in self.component_coordinators:
            coordinator = self.component_coordinators[component]
            try:
                await coordinator(effect)
                self.logger.info(f"âœ… Effect propagated to {component}")
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.error(f"Effect propagation failed for {component}: {e}")

    async def measure_compound_velocity(self) -> VelocityMeasurement:
        """Measure current compound velocity"""
        
        # Count learning events in measurement window
        current_time = datetime.now()
        window_start = current_time - timedelta(seconds=self.measurement_frequency)
        
        # Count events in current window
        events_count = 0
        total_impact = 0.0
        contributing_components = set()
        
        # Read recent events
        if self.learning_events.exists():
            with open(self.learning_events, 'r') as f:
                for line in f:
                    try:
                        event_data = json.loads(line.strip())
                        event_time = datetime.fromisoformat(event_data["timestamp"])
                        
                        if event_time >= window_start:
                            events_count += 1
                            total_impact += event_data.get("velocity_impact", 0.0)
                            contributing_components.add(event_data["source_component"])
                    except (json.JSONDecodeError, KeyError, ValueError):
                        continue
        
        # Calculate compound effects
        compound_effects_data = []
        total_amplification = 1.0
        
        for effect in self.active_compound_effects.values():
            effect_data = {
                "effect_id": effect.effect_id,
                "magnitude": effect.magnitude,
                "amplification": effect.amplification_factor
            }
            compound_effects_data.append(effect_data)
            total_amplification *= effect.amplification_factor
        
        # Calculate current velocity with compound effects
        velocity_from_events = 1.0 + total_impact
        current_velocity = velocity_from_events * min(total_amplification, 3.0)  # Cap amplification at 3x
        
        # Calculate improvement factor
        improvement_factor = current_velocity / self.velocity_baseline
        
        # Calculate acceleration rate (change in improvement over time)
        acceleration_rate = 0.0
        if hasattr(self, 'previous_improvement'):
            time_delta = self.measurement_frequency / 3600.0  # Convert to hours
            acceleration_rate = (improvement_factor - self.previous_improvement) / time_delta
        
        self.previous_improvement = improvement_factor
        
        measurement = VelocityMeasurement(
            measurement_id=self.generate_measurement_id(),
            timestamp=current_time.isoformat(),
            baseline_velocity=self.velocity_baseline,
            current_velocity=current_velocity,
            improvement_factor=improvement_factor,
            contributing_components=list(contributing_components),
            learning_events_count=events_count,
            compound_effects=compound_effects_data,
            acceleration_rate=acceleration_rate,
            sustainability_score=self.calculate_sustainability_score(improvement_factor, acceleration_rate)
        )
        
        self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“ˆ Velocity measured: {current_velocity:.2f} (factor: {improvement_factor:.2f})")
        return measurement

    def generate_measurement_id(self) -> str:
        """Generate unique measurement ID"""
        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
        return f"velocity_{timestamp}"

    def calculate_sustainability_score(self, improvement_factor: float, acceleration_rate: float) -> float:
        """Calculate sustainability score for velocity improvements"""
        
        # Sustainability decreases with extreme improvements (unsustainable)
        improvement_sustainability = 1.0 - max(0, (improvement_factor - 2.0) / 3.0)
        
        # Positive acceleration is good, but extreme acceleration is unsustainable
        acceleration_sustainability = 1.0 - abs(acceleration_rate) / 10.0
        acceleration_sustainability = max(0.0, acceleration_sustainability)
        
        # Combine factors
        sustainability = (improvement_sustainability + acceleration_sustainability) / 2.0
        
        return max(0.0, min(1.0, sustainability))

    async def store_velocity_measurement(self, measurement: VelocityMeasurement):
        """Store velocity measurement"""
        
        measurements = []
        if self.velocity_measurements.exists():
            with open(self.velocity_measurements, 'r') as f:
                measurements = json.load(f)
        
        measurements.append(asdict(measurement))
        
        # Keep last 1000 measurements
        if len(measurements) > 1000:
            measurements = measurements[-1000:]
        
        with open(self.velocity_measurements, 'w') as f:
            json.dump(measurements, f, indent=2)

        self.logger.info(f"ðŸš€ Amplifying velocity improvements: {measurement.improvement_factor:.2f}x")

            effect_type="velocity_amplification",
            magnitude=measurement.improvement_factor - 1.0,
            propagation_path=["system_wide"],
            amplification_factor=1.0 + (measurement.improvement_factor - 1.0) * 0.2,  # 20% of improvement as bonus

            measurable_outcomes=[
                {"metric": "amplification_bonus", "value": (measurement.improvement_factor - 1.0) * 0.2}
            ]
        )
        
        self.active_compound_effects[amplification_effect.effect_id] = amplification_effect
        self.effect_propagation_queue.append(amplification_effect)

    async def evolve_knowledge_graph(self):
        """Evolve knowledge graph based on learning patterns"""
        
        # Find knowledge nodes with high usage
        high_usage_nodes = [
            node for node in self.knowledge_nodes.values()
            if node.usage_frequency > 10
        ]
        
        # Create connections between related nodes
        for i, node_a in enumerate(high_usage_nodes):
            for node_b in high_usage_nodes[i+1:]:
                if self.calculate_node_similarity(node_a, node_b) > 0.7:
                    # Add edge if not exists
                    if not self.knowledge_network.has_edge(node_a.node_id, node_b.node_id):
                        self.knowledge_network.add_edge(
                            node_a.node_id,
                            node_b.node_id,
                            weight=self.calculate_node_similarity(node_a, node_b)
                        )

    def calculate_node_similarity(self, node_a: KnowledgeNode, node_b: KnowledgeNode) -> float:
        """Calculate similarity between knowledge nodes"""
        
        # Simple similarity based on knowledge type and component source
        type_similarity = 1.0 if node_a.knowledge_type == node_b.knowledge_type else 0.3
        
        source_a = node_a.content.get("source_component", "")
        source_b = node_b.content.get("source_component", "")
        source_similarity = 0.8 if source_a == source_b else 0.2
        
        # Content similarity (simplified)
        insight_a = node_a.content.get("insight", "").lower()
        insight_b = node_b.content.get("insight", "").lower()
        
        common_words = set(insight_a.split()) & set(insight_b.split())
        content_similarity = len(common_words) / max(len(insight_a.split()) + len(insight_b.split()) - len(common_words), 1)
        
        return (type_similarity * 0.4 + source_similarity * 0.3 + content_similarity * 0.3)

    async def calculate_compound_effects(self):
        """Calculate and update compound effects"""
        
        # Decay old effects
        current_time = datetime.now()
        effects_to_remove = []
        
        for effect_id, effect in self.active_compound_effects.items():
            # Remove temporary effects after 1 hour
            if effect.duration == "temporary":
                # Check if effect is older than 1 hour
                effects_to_remove.append(effect_id)
        
        for effect_id in effects_to_remove:
            del self.active_compound_effects[effect_id]

        status = {
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "velocity_metrics": {
                "current_velocity": self.current_velocity,
                "baseline_velocity": self.velocity_baseline,
                "improvement_factor": self.current_velocity / self.velocity_baseline
            },
            "knowledge_graph": {
                "total_nodes": len(self.knowledge_nodes),
                "total_edges": self.knowledge_network.number_of_edges(),
                "avg_node_connections": self.knowledge_network.number_of_edges() / max(len(self.knowledge_nodes), 1)
            },
            "compound_effects": {
                "active_effects": len(self.active_compound_effects),
                "total_magnitude": sum(e.magnitude for e in self.active_compound_effects.values())
            },
            "learning_activity": {
                "events_in_buffer": len(self.learning_events_buffer),
                "component_integrations": len(self.component_coordinators)
            }
        }
        
        return status

async def main():
    """Main entry point for compound learning infrastructure"""
    import argparse
    
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Renaissance Compound Learning Infrastructure")
    parser.add_argument("--initialize", action="store_true", help="Initialize compound learning system")
    parser.add_argument("--record-event", nargs=4, help="Record learning event: component type context insights")
    parser.add_argument("--measure-velocity", action="store_true", help="Measure compound velocity")
    parser.add_argument("--status", action="store_true", help="Show compound learning status")
    parser.add_argument("--evolve-knowledge", action="store_true", help="Evolve knowledge graph")
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    infrastructure = CompoundLearningInfrastructure()
    
    if args.initialize:
        await infrastructure.initialize_compound_learning_system()
        print("Compound learning system initialized")
    
    elif args.record_event:
        component, interaction_type, context, insights = args.record_event
        event_id = await infrastructure.record_learning_event(
            component,
            interaction_type,
            {"context": context},
            [insights],
            0.3,
            0.8
        )
        print(f"Learning event recorded: {event_id}")
    
    elif args.measure_velocity:
        measurement = await infrastructure.measure_compound_velocity()
        print(f"Velocity measurement: {measurement.current_velocity:.2f} (factor: {measurement.improvement_factor:.2f})")
    
    elif args.status:
        status = await infrastructure.get_compound_learning_status()
        print(f"Compound Learning Status:")
        print(f"  Current velocity: {status['velocity_metrics']['current_velocity']:.2f}")
        print(f"  Improvement factor: {status['velocity_metrics']['improvement_factor']:.2f}")
        print(f"  Knowledge nodes: {status['knowledge_graph']['total_nodes']}")
        print(f"  Active effects: {status['compound_effects']['active_effects']}")
    
    elif args.evolve_knowledge:
        await infrastructure.evolve_knowledge_graph()
        print("Knowledge graph evolution completed")
    
    else:
        print("Renaissance Compound Learning Infrastructure - Use --help for options")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(main())

   655â†’    async def optimization_loop(self):
   656â†’        """Continuous agent optimization loop"""
   657â†’        while True:
   658â†’            try:
   659â†’                await asyncio.sleep(self.performance_evaluation_interval)
   660â†’                
   661â†’                # Evaluate all active agents
   662â†’                optimizations = await self.evaluate_agent_performance()
   663â†’                
   664â†’                # Apply optimizations
   665â†’                for optimization in optimizations:
   666â†’                    await self.apply_agent_optimization(optimization)
   667â†’                
   668â†’            except Exception as e:
   669â†’                self.logger.error(f"Optimization loop error: {e}")
   670â†’                await asyncio.sleep(60)

   673â†’        """Evaluate agent performance and identify optimization opportunities"""
   674â†’        optimizations = []

   676â†’        for instance_id, agent in self.active_agents.items():
   677â†’            # Performance evaluation
   678â†’            performance = agent.performance_metrics
   679â†’            
   680â†’            # Check for recycling candidates
   681â†’            if (agent.delegation_effectiveness < self.recycling_threshold or
   682â†’                agent.status == "idle" and 
   683â†’                datetime.fromisoformat(agent.last_activity) < datetime.now() - timedelta(seconds=self.agent_idle_timeout)):
   684â†’                
   685â†’                optimization = AgentOptimization(
   686â†’                    optimization_id=self.generate_optimization_id(),
   687â†’                    target_agent=instance_id,
   688â†’                    optimization_type="recycle",
   689â†’                    reason="Low performance or idle timeout",
   690â†’                    expected_impact=0.1,
   691â†’                    implementation_plan={"action": "graceful_shutdown", "cleanup": True},
   692â†’                    compound_velocity_gain=-agent.compound_velocity_impact,  # Negative since removing
   693â†’                    priority=3
   694â†’                )
   695â†’                optimizations.append(optimization)
   696â†’            
   697â†’            # Check for specialization refinement opportunities
   698â†’            elif agent.delegation_effectiveness > self.optimization_threshold:
   699â†’                optimization = AgentOptimization(
   700â†’                    optimization_id=self.generate_optimization_id(),
   701â†’                    target_agent=instance_id,
   702â†’                    optimization_type="specialize",
   703â†’                    reason="High performance indicates specialization opportunity",
   704â†’                    expected_impact=0.3,
   705â†’                    implementation_plan={"action": "enhance_capabilities", "focus_area": agent.specialization},
   706â†’                    compound_velocity_gain=0.2,
   707â†’                    priority=2
   708â†’                )
   709â†’                optimizations.append(optimization)
   710â†’        
   711â†’        return optimizations

   781â†’    async def delegate_task_to_optimal_agent(self, task: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   782â†’        """Delegate task to the most suitable agent"""
   783â†’        
   784â†’        # Find best agent for task
   785â†’        best_agent = None
   786â†’        best_score = 0.0
   787â†’        
   788â†’        for instance_id, agent in self.active_agents.items():
   789â†’            if agent.status == "active":
   790â†’                # Calculate suitability score
   791â†’                score = self.calculate_delegation_suitability(agent, task)
   792â†’                if score > best_score:
   793â†’                    best_score = score
   794â†’                    best_agent = agent
   795â†’        
   796â†’        if best_agent and best_score > 0.5:
   797â†’            # Delegate to best agent
   798â†’            try:
   799â†’                # In practice, would call agent's delegate_task method
   800â†’                result = {
   801â†’                    "status": "delegated",
   802â†’                    "agent_id": best_agent.agent_id,
   803â†’                    "instance_id": best_agent.instance_id,
   804â†’                    "delegation_score": best_score,
   805â†’                    "expected_compound_velocity": best_agent.compound_velocity_impact
   806â†’                }
   807â†’                
   808â†’                # Update agent activity
   809â†’                best_agent.last_activity = datetime.now().isoformat()
   810â†’                best_agent.task_history.append({
   811â†’                    "task_type": task.get("type", "unknown"),
   812â†’                    "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
   813â†’                    "delegation_score": best_score
   814â†’                })
   815â†’                
   816â†’                self.logger.info(f"ðŸ“‹ Delegated task to agent: {best_agent.agent_id} (score: {best_score:.2f})")
   817â†’                return result
   818â†’                
   819â†’            except Exception as e:
   820â†’                self.logger.error(f"Delegation failed: {e}")
   821â†’        
   822â†’        # No suitable agent found
   823â†’        return {
   824â†’            "status": "no_suitable_agent",
   825â†’            "reason": f"No active agent found with sufficient suitability (best score: {best_score:.2f})"
   826â†’        }
   827â†’
   828â†’    def calculate_delegation_suitability(self, agent: AgentInstance, task: Dict[str, Any]) -> float:
   829â†’        """Calculate how suitable an agent is for a specific task"""
   830â†’        
   831â†’        # Base suitability on specialization match
   832â†’        task_type = task.get("type", "").lower()
   833â†’        specialization = agent.specialization.lower()
   834â†’        
   835â†’        base_score = 0.0
   836â†’        if specialization in task_type or task_type in specialization:
   837â†’            base_score = 0.8
   838â†’        elif any(word in task_type for word in specialization.split("_")):
   839â†’            base_score = 0.6
   840â†’        else:
   841â†’            base_score = 0.2
   842â†’        
   843â†’        # Adjust for performance metrics
   844â†’        performance_factor = (
   845â†’            agent.performance_metrics.get("success_rate", 0.5) * 0.4 +
   846â†’            agent.delegation_effectiveness * 0.3 +
   847â†’            agent.compound_velocity_impact * 0.3
   848â†’        )
   849â†’        
   850â†’        # Resource availability factor
   851â†’        resource_factor = 1.0 - (agent.resource_usage.get("cpu_usage", 0.0) + 
   852â†’                                 agent.resource_usage.get("memory_usage", 0.0)) / 2.0
   853â†’        
   854â†’        # Final suitability score
   855â†’        suitability = base_score * performance_factor * resource_factor
   856â†’        
   857â†’        return min(suitability, 1.0)
   858â†’
   859â†’    async def optimize_for_memory_pressure(self):
   860â†’        """Optimize agent ecosystem for memory pressure"""
   861â†’        self.logger.info("âš ï¸ Optimizing for memory pressure...")
   862â†’        
   863â†’        # Find least effective agents for recycling
   864â†’        agents_by_effectiveness = sorted(
   865â†’            self.active_agents.items(),
   866â†’            key=lambda x: x[1].delegation_effectiveness
   867â†’        )
   868â†’        
   869â†’        # Recycle lowest performing agents
   870â†’        for instance_id, agent in agents_by_effectiveness[:2]:  # Recycle bottom 2
   871â†’            if agent.delegation_effectiveness < 0.4:
   872â†’                await self.recycle_agent(instance_id)
   873â†’
   874â†’    async def get_agent_ecosystem_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   875â†’        """Get comprehensive agent ecosystem status"""
   876â†’        
   877â†’        status = {
   878â†’            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
   879â†’            "total_active_agents": len(self.active_agents),
   880â†’            "agent_specializations": {},
   881â†’            "performance_summary": {

   883â†’                "total_compound_velocity_impact": 0.0,
   884â†’                "total_tasks_completed": 0
   885â†’            },
   886â†’            "resource_utilization": {
   887â†’                "total_cpu_usage": 0.0,
   888â†’                "total_memory_usage": 0.0
   889â†’            },
   890â†’            "optimization_opportunities": []
   891â†’        }
   892â†’        
   893â†’        # Aggregate statistics
   894â†’        total_effectiveness = 0.0
   895â†’        total_compound_impact = 0.0
   896â†’        total_tasks = 0
   897â†’        
   898â†’        for agent in self.active_agents.values():
   899â†’            # Specialization counting
   900â†’            specialization = agent.specialization
   901â†’            if specialization not in status["agent_specializations"]:
   902â†’                status["agent_specializations"][specialization] = 0
   903â†’            status["agent_specializations"][specialization] += 1
   904â†’            
   905â†’            # Performance aggregation
   906â†’            total_effectiveness += agent.delegation_effectiveness
   907â†’            total_compound_impact += agent.compound_velocity_impact
   908â†’            total_tasks += agent.performance_metrics.get("tasks_completed", 0)
   909â†’            
   910â†’            # Resource aggregation
   911â†’            status["resource_utilization"]["total_cpu_usage"] += agent.resource_usage.get("cpu_usage", 0.0)
   912â†’            status["resource_utilization"]["total_memory_usage"] += agent.resource_usage.get("memory_usage", 0.0)
   913â†’        
   914â†’        # Calculate averages
   915â†’        if self.active_agents:
   916â†’            status["performance_summary"]["average_delegation_effectiveness"] = total_effectiveness / len(self.active_agents)
   917â†’        
   918â†’        status["performance_summary"]["total_compound_velocity_impact"] = total_compound_impact
   919â†’        status["performance_summary"]["total_tasks_completed"] = total_tasks
   920â†’        
   921â†’        return status
